summary: Gerald P Hamilton was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents detail his position, annual salary, and gross pay for various accounting periods. The documents suggest he was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Gerald P Hamilton's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee responsible for reinvestigating the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in the provided documents, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation.
